Class Arabic

java.lang.Object
Arabic
public class Arabic
extends java.lang.Object
The Arabic class provides a blueprint for creating, validating, and converting an Arabic numeral to a Roman numeral.
Since:
8/28/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int arabic
    This private instance variable represents the Arabic numeral input by the user in the Arabic text area
    private java.lang.String roman
    This private instance variable represents the Roman numeral that is calculated in arabicToRoman() using the Arabic numeral that is input by the user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Arabic​(java.lang.String arabic)
    This is the sole constructor for the Arabic class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void arabicToRoman()
    This method uses the (valid) arabic instance variable to compute the corresponding Roman numeral.
    int getArabic()
    This is the getter for the arabic instance variable.
    java.lang.String getRoman()
    This is the getter method for the roman instance variable.
    void setArabic​(java.lang.String arabic)
    This is the setter method for the arabic instance variable.
    void setRoman​(java.lang.String roman)
    This is the setter for the roman instance variable.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • arabic

      private int arabic
      This private instance variable represents the Arabic numeral input by the user in the Arabic text area

    • roman

      private java.lang.String roman
      This private instance variable represents the Roman numeral that is calculated in arabicToRoman() using the Arabic numeral that is input by the user.

  • Constructor Details

    • Arabic

      public Arabic​(java.lang.String arabic)
      This is the sole constructor for the Arabic class. It takes a String as a parameter and passes that string to the setArabic setter method.
      Parameters:
      arabic - This is a string that contains an Arabic numeral

  • Method Details

    • setArabic

      public void setArabic​(java.lang.String arabic)
      This is the setter method for the arabic instance variable. It takes a String as a parameter and checks to see whether the string represents a valid Arabic numeral in the range 1-3999. If the string is valid, the method uses it to set the arabic instance variable and then calls the arabicToRoman() method. If the string is not valid, the method sets the arabic instance variable to an 'invalid' message.
      Parameters:
      arabic - This string contains an Arabic numeral

    • setRoman

      public void setRoman​(java.lang.String roman)
      This is the setter for the roman instance variable. Currently this method is never called.
      Parameters:
      roman - This String represents a Roman numeral that will be assigned to the roman instance variable.

    • getArabic

      public int getArabic()
      This is the getter for the arabic instance variable. Currently this method is never called.
      Returns:
      This method returns an int that represents the user-input arabic instance variable.

    • getRoman

      public java.lang.String getRoman()
      This is the getter method for the roman instance variable. It simply returns the roman instance variable.
      Returns:
      This method returns a String that contains the calculated roman instance variable.

    • arabicToRoman

      public void arabicToRoman()
      This method uses the (valid) arabic instance variable to compute the corresponding Roman numeral. After computing the Roman numeral, it sets the roman instance variable.
